title: Chicken Chow Mein

steps.instruction: Clear, imperative instruction
Mix chicken strips with 1 tbsp light soy sauce, 2 tbsp water and set aside for 10 minutes
Cut 1/2 of a medium sized cabbage and remove the core
Thinly slice the cabbage
Cut 2 carrots into matchsticks
Finely chop the white part
Slice and mince 1/2 tbsp ginger
Sauce: 1 tbsp light soy sauce, 1.5 tbsp dark soy sauce, 2 tbsp oyster sauce, 1 tbsp water, 1 tsp sugar
Mix chicken strips with 2 tbsp cornstarch
Cook noodles 2 minutes less than the package instructions to avoid overcooking
Drain, wash with cold water and coat with 1 tbsp oil
Heat oil in a wok and scramble 2 eggs
Add some more oil and stir fry chicken on high heat
Stir fry ginger, garlic and scallion whites for 1 minute
Add carrots and stir fry until the vegetables are lightly charred
Set aside when done
Heat oil in a wok and scramble 2 eggs
Add some more oil and stir fry chicken on high heat
Stir fry ginger, garlic and scallion whites for 1 minute
Add cabbage and stir fry until the vegetables are lightly charred
Set aside when done
Stir fry noodles for a couple of minutes
Add back the stir fried chicken and vegetables
Pour in the sauce and mix well
Stir fry for a couple of minutes
Taste and adjust salt and pepper as per preference
Add black pepper and MSG (optional for authentic flavor)
Add a few drops of sesame oil, eggs, scallion green and mix
Stir fry for 2-3 minutes

source_title: How to make Chicken Chow Mein at home like a chef!
